data.md:MetaData: (Table S1) Analytical reusults of stream water from the Tavignanu River
Riverine carbon dioxide evasion along a high-relief watercourse derived from seasonal dynamics of the water-atmosphere gas exchange

The high-relief catchment of the Tavignanu River (Corsica Island, France) with an elevation range from sea level to 2622 m above sea level was investigated from January 2016 to April 2017 for its on-site parameters (T, pH, EC, TA), riverine carbon budget (TCO2) and stable carbon isotopes (d13C). Partial pressure of CO2 (pCO2) and annual carbon flux across the air-water boundary (FCO2) were calculated from analytical results. This data set contains the supplementary analytical data of the related publication.
